A 65-year-old CEO of a MNC received a severe blow on his head that caused a depressed fracture of his frontal bone. He was admitted in the hospital and discharged after 72 hours of observation. questions.correct_answer: A. Displacement of the intraocular lens is less common with capsulorrhexis than can-opener capsulotomy

questions.text: The following are true about local anaesthesia:

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Lignocaine requires a shorter time than marcaine to achieve anaesthesia

options.label: C
options.text: Lignocaine has a longer duration of action than marcaine

options.label: D
options.text: Retrobulbar haemorrhage increases the risk of expulsive haemorrhage

questions.correct_answer: C. Lignocaine has a longer duration of action than marcaine

Which of the following statements is not considered routine practice in a patient presenting with symptoms suggestive of an esophageal perforation?

options.label: A
options.text: The patient should be observed for 4 hours and, if pain improves, discharged home.

options.label: B
options.text: The diagnostic studies of choice are computed tomography and emergency endoscopy.

options.label: C
options.text: Appropriate resuscitation includes hemodynamic stabilization, airway protection, and broad-spectrum antibiotic coverage.

options.label: D
options.text: Emergent gastroenterology and/or surgical consultation should be obtained in every patient with a suspected esophageal perforation.

questions.correct_answer: A. The patient should be observed for 4 hours and, if pain improves, discharged home.

questions.text: An 18-year-old man is stabbed in his abdomen multiple times. He has four stab wounds of the abdomen—three are in the right upper quadrant, and one is in the left lower quadrant. The patient continues to have multiple episodes of bleeding in the emergency room. Upper endoscopy reveals an actively bleeding duodenal ulcer. Cautery and sclerotherapy are unable to control the bleeding.T-37, HR-95, BP-110/80, RP-16. The most appropriate first maneuver after entering the abdomen is: -

options.label: A
options.text: Dissect out the celiac axis to obtain easy vascular control.

options.label: B
options.text: Duodenotomy, suture the ulcer base to ligate the gastroduodenal artery

options.label: C
options.text: Duodenotomy, suture ulcer base to ligate common duodenal artery

options.label: D
options.text: Manually compress the aorta to obtain vascular control.

questions.correct_answer: B. Duodenotomy, suture the ulcer base to ligate the gastroduodenal artery
